intro: Nissolia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate nissolia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
